title: Ex-Government Servants (Employment with Foreign Governments) (Prohibition) Act, 1966
title_en: Ex-Government Servants (Employment with Foreign Governments) (Prohibition) Act, 1966
description: Official consolidated text of Ex-Government Servants (Employment with Foreign Governments) (Prohibition) Act, 1966 (XII of 1966) published by The Pakistan Code (Service Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement.― (1) This Act may be called the Ex
provisions.content:
Government
Servants (Employment with Foreign Governments) (Prohibition) Act, 1966.
(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.
(3) It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions
provisions.content:
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant, in the subject or context,—
(a)        “ex-Government servant” means any person who was, at any time, appointed
or employed as an officer or servant of the 2[Federal Government] or a
Provincial Government and has ceased to be so appointed or employed;
(b)        “foreign agency” means any office or establishment of the diplomatic or
consular representative of a foreign Government by whatever name called, and
includes any information, public relations, trade or commercial agency,
service centre or foundation established or maintained by any such Govern-
ment or by any person who is a national of a foreign country ; and
(c)        “foreign Government” means the Government of a foreign country.

provisions.title: Section 3. Prohibition of employment etc. ― (1) No ex
provisions.content:
Government servant shall, except with the
previous permission in writing of the 2[Federal Government], 3[or a person or authority authorized by
it in this behalf] seek or take up employment as an officer or servant of a foreign government or a
foreign agency.
(2) No ex-Government servant who is, at the commencement of this Act, in the service of a
foreign government or a foreign agency shall, except with the permission in writing of the 4[Federal
Government], continue in such service after the expiry of three months from such commencement.
5
[4. Penalty. Whoever contravenes the provisions of section 3 shall be punishable with
imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven year, or with fine which may extend to fifty
thousand rupees, or with forfeiture of property, or with any two or more of the said punishments.].
1
For Statement of Objects and reasons, see Gaz. of P., 1966, Ext., P. 335 (R)

5
